column1: 5)  The medical evidence is that the deceased may have died of drowning due
to  several  ways  of  drowning  which  had  been  totally  ignored  by  the  trial
judge and she had completely chosen not to mention the medical evidence
Hence  upon  considering  the  above  we  find  that  even  if  the  jury  had  been
properly directed by the trial judge, the verdict delivered could not have been
reached due to the inadequate evidence led at the trial.
As such we are compelled to set aside the verdict entered by the jury
and the sentence imposed on the appellants by the trial judge and allow
